headline: Easy Homemade Pizza Sauce
description: Learn how to make homemade pizza sauce with this simple, no-cook recipe made with steeped tomato paste, olive oil, garlic, oregano, basil, and rosemary.

video.description: See how to make a simple no-cook pizza sauce.
video.name: Easy Pizza Sauce I

name: Easy Homemade Pizza Sauce
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together water, tomato paste, and olive oil in a large bowl or jar. Add garlic, oregano, basil, rosemary, salt, and pepper; mix well.
Let sauce stand for several hours to let flavors blend. No cooking is necessary; just spread on dough.

review.reviewBody: I ended up dumping it down the sink Super watery. Way too much liquid. It was the consistency of tomato juice On top of that I was in a time crunch so I used something else Definitely want to try again starting with less time than half the liquid. I’m Canadian and maybe our tomato paste is different.
It was so easy just use Italian season parsley minced garlic salt and pepper and that was it oh and tomato paste

This is incredible! If you’re having a tinny taste, add a Tablespoon of Sugar. I ONLY added 1 cup of water. My experience told me it’d be too runny. I also add beef bullion that gave it a meat flavored yummy sauce. Making it into a Chicago deep dish. A keeper! Thank you.
Note to self. Decrease water and oil by half. Add onion powder and fennel.
Excellent, I reduced the water as suggested.

I love this recipe! The consistency is perfect and the flavor is wonderful, and such a simple recipe! I read the reviews prior to making this sauce, so I was on the lookout for it being too watery. That turned out not to be a problem. That makes me wonder if people were using tomato sauce rather than tomato paste, which might cause it to be too thin. The tomato paste gives it nice, rich tomato flavor!

Used the recipe exactly as it says. I used my ninja to blend it properly and it came out perfectly. Not too thin, not too thick, but just right. The only thing I might change next time is cut back slightly on the rosemary. I would prefer it with just a smig less.
This recipe made my "Top 10" list of new recipes tried in 2022. So easy and flavourful.
After reading the reviews, I used one can of water w/the tomato paste. 1/6 of a cup of olive oil. 1 tsp salt, 1/4 pepper. Add water and oil until desired thickness and taste. Will make again.

It's not terrible as long as you cut back on the water or add extra tomato paste. I ended up using a second can of tomato paste, and it's still thinner than what pizza sauce should be. I also added a dash of red wine vinegar and extra spices and garlic.
Great recipe if you want to soak some pizza dough. Otherwise, try using a lot less liquid.
It’s good
this was the best pizza sauce I ever made in my life loved it and deffently will try again.
No I love pizza and I love garlic!
IT WAS VERY EASY TO MAKE AND VERY DELICIOUS.. THANKS FOR SHARING

After reading the comments I cut the water to 3/4 cup. I did not change anything else plus added 1/2 tsp sugar. I let this sit about 2 hours on the countertop while the crust was rising and being shaped. The flavors were great. Everyone loved it including the picky grandkid. This is definitely a keeper. It would also be a great dipping sauce for garlic bread sticks - with a bit of red pepper flakes added perhaps for some kick.
Very good sauce. I used 1/2-3/4 Cup of water (add slowly until the correct consistancy) and I added some dried onion and 1/2-1 tsp sugar to it. As it sits, it becomes much better.

I am not sure why everyone is giving this recipe five stars, it is way too watery. Yes if you use a quarter of the water it calls for then it works fine, but if that is required then five stars is not what it deserves.

Had to add an additional can of tomato paste, salt, and spices. Other than that it was pretty tasty and made enough for two more pizzas. I guess either decrease the water or go ahead and add tomato paste.
I should have read the comments first. This recipe is WAY too watery to the point that it was unusable!
Make note: you said 1- 6 oz can paste, this is way to thin! I had to add another can, not sure if anyone else noted the thinness of this sauce recipe!
It’s so delicious!
We enjoyed this sauce. I agree with other recommendations to use 3/4 cup water and 1/2 tsp of sugar. I double all the herbs to 1 tsp each.

So, the first time I made this and heeded the warnings about it being too watery, and started with 2/3 cup of water with the option to add more, and it was perfect. The second time I forgot and added alllllll cup and a half of water. And yeah, maybe it's a Bloody Mary mix now? Trying to cook it down some, smells good though.

Been looking for a good sauce recipe and excited to have found this! Per another review I halved the water and added 1/2 tsp. of sugar. I didn’t include the rosemary and used fresh basil instead of dried. Because I love amounts when something says “salt and pepper to taste” I used 1/4 tsp. Pepper and 3/8 tsp. Salt.
Way too much water. This is not soup we are trying to make here.
I didn’t read the comments so I didn’t know to not cut the water. I wouldn’t recommend.
its is extremely good i put it on my meatball sub and it tasted pike heaven
Not bad as long as you don’t put that much oil. It’s way too much and all you can taste is the oil when you eat the pizza.
Easy peasy! Super tasty!

This pizza sauce is an absolute winner! The only change I made is to use 12 oz of tomato paste as we prefer a thicker sauce. (I increased the spices as well). I used this on the "Italian Feather Bread Pizza dough," also on this site.
Super easy. This is my go to pizza sauce.
Really easy and surprisingly flavorful sauce! The whole recipe is quick to make and was a hit with the family. I used a reduced amount of water and roasted garlic.
It was very watery, but it worked for what it was needed for.
So delicious! But since I like my sauce thicker, I added a second 6oz can of tomato paste and not only did it come out perfect, but I had enough for a 2nd pizza! Thanks for the recipe!

I added less than 1/2 teaspoon of sugar and 1 extra clove of garlic.. This is the first red sauce that I have liked. Oh yes, I will make it again. 
 I give it 4 1/2 stars.
Great! Super easy and really tasty!

Hi. This came out as horrible. The acidity of the tomato paste and the oily-ness of the oil did not mix well. I understand you have to let everything sit and settle, but I wanted something quick and easy! Not something that would take forever! Instead I watched a YouTube video with someone else and it turned out perfect! Much better than this. I do not recommend this recipe to anyone!
I added a second can of paste cuz it was kinda soupy. Left enough for 2 really big pizzas
It‘s delicious!
I didn't add the garlic, used garlic powder. I didn't have oregano. It was great!
I have mad it several times already and always get compliments on my pizza!! Thank you!!
A good base to make it your own and very easy to make.
Meh. Tastes like pasta sauce, not pizza sauce.

Was very simple and tasty. A little too watery, so I heated it on low heat on stove for 30+ minutes or so and the sauce thickened really nicely and was very delicious. I plan to use on my lasagna this weekend.

Loved the flavor on this. I used only a cup of water. 1/3 tsp of salt and pepper and used dried garlic instead of fresh and a little dried onion (maybe 1/8 tsp). I used a mortar for the basil, rosemary and oregano- they all have better flavor when you do that. Also I just put the ingredients in tall glass and used an immersion blender to mix. Used immediately and we enjoyed the flavor.

Super easy, tastes great. I made this when I was ready to sauce my homemade dough with toppings all prepped, and found myself without sauce! This was so fast and totally saved my pizza! Also, I live in the middle of nowhere, so the limited and simple ingredients made this recipe possible to cook.
It tastes amazing. But I dont understand ther serving size. Can anyone help me out? What is 8 servings? How much is that?
Deeelicious! I make it thicker by adding less oil and water.
My kids loved it. Super easy to make, I will definitely make it again.
Returning a second time to this one. Excellent!
Perfect pizza sauce. It did have a little bitter taste to me compared to other sauces I've had but my toddler enjoyed it and his mini cheese pizza.
Very easy and definitely tastier than store bought!
I changed up the recipe a bit cause I didn’t have all the listed ingredients. I used 1 1/2 tsp of Italian seasoning. Flavor was superb.
I did not used some ingredient but it was great
I was very pleased. It was delicious on my homemade pizza crust.
I made this for family. They said they didn't mind but the overpowering taste and smell of oil was too much for me. Couldn't eat it. Reduce oil to half or less the amount.
There was too much water so i added more paste...
Awesome!! I'm not a fan of Rosemary so i omitted that. I took the advice of a previous review and cut the water to 2/3 and only 2 tbsp olive oil. Turned out perfect for dipping Mozzarella sticks!

I love this recipe. So easy, no cooking. For one person, I use tomato paste from a tube and adjust quantity without wasting food. Flavourful. The only adjustment I usually make is to reduce the water by half to start and if I need more, I add it a bit at a time. Keeps well for day 2, if I have enough dough for another day.
I used quite a bit less water. I think next time I will cut water back even more still.
I didn't have rosemary. but it was a great sauce without it.
Great easy recipe. Didn't add any salt. Very delicious.
I didn’t read the other reviews before I made this. It is a very runny sauce but it thickened up a little overnight in the fridge.
The flavors are good but the recipe call for way too much water.
Loved it. It was a little thin, so next time I'd decrease the water, but it tasted very good.

Read other's reviews about recipe edits! This would be really good if taking the water way down and adding some sweetness... Water should be 1/4-1/3C and slowly add more as desired. I also added 1/2T of sugar. 

I spent 45 minutes simmering down the water content. The oil never fully mixed in. I would think adding vinegar or ketchup would help as an emulsifier.

Overall if you only have tomato paste as I did and not any other tomato product this would work as a sauce, just going expect great results as the recipe stands.
excellent

This is a very good sauce, but again, everyone’s taste buds are different. I adjusted the water as well, it was going to be runny if I didn’t, 2/3 cups was plenty, I also doubled the amount of salt and pepper (more pepper than salt - 20 grinds of pink salt and 30 grinds of pepper). Just waiting to put it on pizza, but aroma filled the house and very easy to make!

This could use less water and MORE seasoning! But I love flavorful sauces. Extra sugar, salt, garlic powder, onion powder, crushed red pepper flakes and a teaspoon or two of italian seasoning doctored it up.
I halved the water & decreased oil to 1/4c. Tasted great. Didn't have time to let it sit so probably will be even better next time!
I loved this! It really was so delicious. Next time though, I’ll omit the oil.
Love the simplicity of the recipe! Made it adding oil and water in small increments till I found the consistency I wanted . Delish!

I am only giving it three stars because I had to tweak it quite a bit. As others suggested I cut the water in half, I'm so glad I did because it would have been super runny. I also reduced the olive oil to 1/4 a cup and added an extra garlic clove. Then, I threw it all in a blender which worked really well. After all these adjustments I can say that my whole family really enjoyed the sauce, my husband especially :)

This recipe makes a very nice pizza sauce that's really easy too. I reduce the water a bit and add a bit of brown sugar in there for a bit of sweetness. I usually make this and use it shortly afterwards but this last time I didn't use the sauce until about a day and half later. Oh my goodness is it SO delicious after it sits for a while in the fridge! My husband has gone on and on about it ever since, saying it's the best pizza sauce he's ever had. So a word to the wise, this recipe is even 10 times better a day later!
I will try again with less water. I think it's too thin. I'm going to try heating it for awhile to blend flavors better and hopefully let it thicken.

Love this recipe! Cut the water in half and doubled all other ingredients except for olive oil. Highly recommend. Saving this recipe for future reference! If you like a lot of thick sauce on your pizza, this is the recipe to try!

Love this recipe! Cut the water in half and doubled all other ingredients except for olive oil. Highly recommend. Saving this recipe for future reference! If you like a lot of thick sauce on your pizza, this is the recipe to try!
Good sauce. I didn't have tomato sauce only paste, so this was perfect. I used only 1 cup water and added little sugar.
Loved it..so easy.. Adapted..less water , just used pizza spice.. does anyone know if you can freeze the leftovers?

It was much too runny for my taste. I would change two things. I would only use a half cup of water, 1-2 tablespoons of olive oil.
I ended up simmering mine to reduce the liquid.
A good sauce

The taste is amazing! I'll never buy pre-made sauce again. I did change the liquid amounts to 2/3 cup of water and 1/4 cup olive oil and that was perfect. Also substituted garlic powder for the cloves.
This sauce is amazing just as it is. don't use less water, when the sauce mixes with the cheese it is perfect. This is a keeper we will be making it again and again.
Made no changes and loved this fresh and easy sauce.

My father always made this sauce with beer instead of water. I like Budweiser beer for this sauce. It adds just a touch of flavor. I think it helps mellow out the acidic tang of the tomato paste and adds just a bit of sweetness to the flavor. I use the olive oil as noted in the recipe and stir in the beer last to get the sauce to the right viscosity. 

It's going to firm up in the refrigerator, so you'll need to add enough beer so that's it's saucy when you put it in. It will be more like a paste when you take it out. It really should sit for a day to set up, but I have found that a minimum of 6 hours in the refrigerator will get the sauce to a reasonable flavor level. Time is always your friend with tomato/garlic combinations.
I would add significantly less water next time; I prefer a thicker sauce. I added a table spoon of sugar and I'm glad I did.
This was so easy - and tasted great!

Not bad for a such quick pizza sauce !
I cut the water by half and added coupe of pinches of sugar.
Half the recipe is plenty to cover a medium to large pizza.

Great flavor! Used it on my New York style. This covered 4 standard size pizzas. I'm not a pizza expert, but 2 of 2 people have loved it so far. About to make pizza for a get together this weekend and am sticking with this recipe!

I eyeball this recipe. I make it in a pint-size mason jar. Add the tomato paste, basil, oregano, garlic powder, freshly ground black pepper to taste and add water to about where the jar starts to curve. Put the lid on the jar and shake everything up! I don't even let it sit, I just use it immediately and if there's leftovers, they are already in a container ready for the fridge. Now I never worry about buying pizza sauce!

I didnt have time to let it sit, so i simmered for 30 mins, and ended up adding a 1.5 tablespoon sugar, thought the sauce was missing something, and the sugar made it to my taste. Spices were on point! Will make again.
Came out as a red water, spent two hours simmering to thicken it.

I have to agree with the amount of water. I followed the recipe, but added another can of tomato paste and adjusted the amount of dried spices according to taste. I also minced five cloves of garlic. Can't wait for homemade pizza for dinner tonight!

I always use this recipe when I make pizza at home! the only things I do differently is I start with a can of Tomato Sauce instead of adding water to tomato paste, and I don't like rosemary so that is omitted. I freeze the leftovers in little Tupperware which is perfect for a quick pizza for lunch on naan =)
Combining easy crust with this sauce, you will enjoy fresh homemade pizza!

This turned out fine in a pinch. I needed a sauce right away. I read the reviews and so I only put in 1 c water and 1/4 c oil. I thought the consistency was perfect with those amounts. I used 1/2 t garlic powder instead of fresh garlic. I kept all other ingredients the same. I didn't have time to let it sit, and it turned out well on the pizza. My son ate it up with no complaints. I will probably make my own pizza sauce again, but take a look at some different recipes or tweak this one some more.

This sauce made me a star!! Well this sauce and some little tweaks did it. My family and guests raved about the pizza and especially the sauce. No more going out for pizza for us. I reduced the water until the thickness was to my liking and dropped the oil down a bit. I then added about 1/2 tsp each of garlic powder and onion powder (maybe a little less)!and a dash of McCormick chili powder. I use whole dry spices and grind them myself with a small mortar and pestle but that's my preference. I let it all sit on the counter for about 4 hours. Awesome!

Awesome recipe... But I wish I listened to other reviewers and decreased the amount of water and oil... I did simmwr it for 5 min on the stove... But I had to add another 6 oz can of tomato paste to thicken it up. But now that I found this recipe I will never have to spend $8+ on organic pizza sauce! I can make my own.
